title: Instructional Design Decision-Making Process: Short-Intensive Course Based on Collaborative Autoethnography

context.prior_knowledge: Foundations of Instructional Design Theory and Curriculum Development Experience
context.additional_context: Systematic analysis of instructional design decision-making processes using collaborative autoethnography in a smartphone-centric learning environment. Learners explore decision-making strategies at multiple levels (institutional/program/course) and conduct project-based assessments.

learning_goals: Learners can systematically explain instructional design decision-making within the bounded rationality framework.
Learners can compare and apply analogy-based decision-making strategies at three levels: institutional/program/course.
Learners can develop practical instructional design implementation strategies using mobile-based collaborative autoethnography in mobile environments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
